properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 23 at 12:09PM CST until January 23 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Springfield MO
properties.description:
...Winter Weather Advisory...

.There remains two separate pieces of the Winter Weather
Advisory. The first will span portions of the eastern Ozarks until
6 PM this evening for Howell, Oregon, Texas, Shannon, and Dent
counties. There, periods of light to moderate snow will continue
into this afternoon. The second piece of the Winter Weather
Advisory goes into effect at 9 PM this evening for counties
generally along and north of the Highway 60 corridor. This second
piece will focus on a new swath of wintry weather that is
anticipated to spread across eastern Kansas and southwest Missouri
late tonight into Friday afternoon.

...A NEW WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY GOES IN EFFECT AT 9 PM THIS EVENING
TO NOON CST FRIDAY AS A NEW SWATH OF WINTRY WEATHER SPREADS ACROSS
SOUTHWEST MISSOURI LATE TONIGHT INTO FRIDAY...


* WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, wet snow.
Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. For the
second Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation expected.
Total snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice
accumulations of a light glaze.

* WHERE...Texas, Dent and Shannon Counties.

* WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST
this evening. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 9
PM this evening to noon CST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
properties.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.

NWSheadline: The original WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY remains IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING as periods of light to moderate snow continue through this afternoon across the far eastern Ozarks
